I think it would be more appropriate to add :

7.1 It would be more appropriate to add : The performance rights assignment agreement and this agreement constitute the entire agreement between the parties and supersede all prior agreements between the parties relating to their subject matter. No modification of this agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by each of the parties.  

 

9.1 + 9.3: Given that the event takes place in France and that we are a French company, I think it would be more appropriate that the place of jurisdiction be designated as follows : 

 

9.1 This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter or formation (including non-contractual disputes or claims) shall be governed and construed in accordance  with the laws of the country in which the contract is performed, being France and the competent courts of France.  However, MCT FZE may, at its option, bring the matter before the competent court of the United Arab Emirates, including in the event of multiple defendants or a third-party complaint.

 

9.3 If the Parties are unable to settle any dispute arising out of this Agreement within 21 (twenty-one) days of the dispute arising, each party irrevocably agrees that the competent courts of the country in which the contract is performed, being France and the competent courts of France.  However, MCT FZE may, at its option, bring the matter before the competent court of the United Arab Emirates, including in the event of multiple defendants or a third-party complaint.

 

Please let me know if it work like this for you.

Yes, I can confirm that they are indeed in exchange on the technical aspects, and we should be able to make do with the MAD's limitations. 

	I'm still waiting to receive confirmation and an initial technical sheet to include in the contract you'll find enclosed. 

	I'd also like us to agree as soon as possible on the soundcheck schedule (ideally 3 hours). Should I discuss this directly with WeAreOna's technical director or with you? 

	 

	Finally, just a reminder that Hiba won't perform if a service is provided during her performance, or if the guests are eating. 

	 

	I'll let you tell me if the contract is suitable and fill in the missing information (in yellow). 

	If all goes well, I’ll add the technical sheet and I'll send it to you for a signature via Docusign. 

	 

	Thank you ! 

	 

	— 
	Sarah BIGOT 
	Responsable de production live
	Head of live production

					Here are also a simple list of elements to be taken care of by you and the list of the team that will be present.

					 

					TEAM: 12 PEOPLE MAXIMUM 

					- Hiba Tawaji: singer (ARTIST)

					- 4 musicians (string quartet: 1 viola, 2 violins, 1 cello)

					- 1 pianist 

					- 1 double bass player

					- 1 sound engineer 

					- 1 monitor sound engineer

					- 2 managers

					- 1 producer 

					 

					MATERIAL : 

					- Stage and equipment (to be specified following discussion with our technical teams)

					- 1 minimum 1/4-tone piano with stool 

					- A sound system including 1 microphone and a microphone stand adapted to the venue (to be specified following discussion with our technical teams)

					- A stage lighting system and a lighting technician adapted to the venue

					- 1 double bassist's chair

					- 4 chairs for the string quartet

					- 1 high chair for the ARTIST

					- 5 music stands with lamps

					 

					Everything will also be indicated in the contract but, I realized that I had prepared it in French and therefore need a little time before sending it to you in English. 

					I'm working on it and will get back to you as soon as possible.

			Hello Rula, 

			 

			The original plan was for the orchestra to accompany Hiba Tawaji for 3/4 songs, i.e. about 20 minutes, plus 1 hour of classical program. 

			 

			So it's possible that the orchestra will play from 7pm to 7:30pm, then accompany Hiba from 8:15pm to around 8:40pm, then continue playing until 9pm. 

			 

			I'll let you know if we go for this schedule. 

			 

			Thanks ! 

			 

			— 
			Sarah BIGOT

			Head of live production
			
			MISTER IBÉ

					- 2 managers

					- 1 producer

	Dear Rula, 

	 

	Yes, I can confirm that they are indeed in exchange on the technical aspects, and we should be able to make do with the MAD's limitations. 

	I'm still waiting to receive confirmation and an initial technical sheet to include in the contract you'll find enclosed. 

	I'd also like us to agree as soon as possible on the soundcheck schedule (ideally 3 hours). Should I discuss this directly with WeAreOna's technical director or with you? 

	 

	Finally, just a reminder that Hiba won't perform if a service is provided during her performance, or if the guests are eating. 

	 

	I'll let you tell me if the contract is suitable and fill in the missing information (in yellow). 

	If all goes well, I’ll add the technical sheet and I'll send it to you for a signature via Docusign. 

	 

	Thank you ! 

	 

	— 
	Sarah BIGOT

	Head of live production
